propertyDescriptions.geographicCoverage: Information on the geographic coverage of the data. Includes the total geographic scope of the data.
propertyDescriptions.geographicUnit: Lowest level of geographic aggregation covered by the Dataset, e.g., village, county, region.
propertyDescriptions.geographicBoundingBox: The fundamental geometric description for any Dataset that models geography is the geographic bounding box. It describes the minimum box, defined by west and east longitudes and north and south latitudes, which includes the largest geographic extent of the  Dataset's geographic coverage. This element is used in the first pass of a coordinate-based search. Inclusion of this element in the codebook is recommended, but is required if the bound polygon box is included.

propertyDescriptions.country: The country or nation that the Dataset is about.
propertyDescriptions.state: The state or province that the Dataset is about. Use GeoNames for correct spelling and avoid abbreviations.
propertyDescriptions.city: The name of the city that the Dataset is about. Use GeoNames for correct spelling and avoid abbreviations.
propertyDescriptions.otherGeographicCoverage: Other information on the geographic coverage of the data.

geographicUnit.schema:description: Lowest level of geographic aggregation covered by the Dataset, e.g., village, county, region.

geographicUnit.description: geographicUnit element schema generated by the ARP
geographicUnit.hunDescription: A legkisebb földrajzi egység, amelyet az adatcsomag lefed. Például falu, megye, régió

propertyDescriptions.westLongitude: Westernmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values,  expressed in decimal degrees, is -180,0 <= West  Bounding Longitude Value <= 180,0.
propertyDescriptions.eastLongitude: Easternmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values,  expressed in decimal degrees, is -180,0 <= East Bounding Longitude Value <= 180,0.
propertyDescriptions.northLongitude: Northernmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values,  expressed in decimal degrees, is -90,0 <= North Bounding Latitude Value <= 90,0.
propertyDescriptions.southLongitude: Southernmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values,  expressed in decimal degrees, is -90,0 <= South Bounding Latitude Value <= 90,0.

items.schema:name: geographicBoundingBox
items.schema:description: The fundamental geometric description for any Dataset that models geography is the geographic bounding box. It describes the minimum box, defined by west and east longitudes and north and south latitudes, which includes the largest geographic extent of the  Dataset's geographic coverage. This element is used in the first pass of a coordinate-based search. Inclusion of this element in the codebook is recommended, but is required if the bound polygon box is included.
items.title: geographicBoundingBox element schema
items.description: geographicBoundingBox element schema generated by the ARP
items.hunDescription: Egy földrajzi modellel foglalkozó adatcsomag alapvető leírása a földrajzi határ. Megadja a nyugati és keleti hosszúság, illetve az északi és déli szélesség által meghatározott legkisebb olyan határvonalat, amelybe a földrajzi lefedettség belefér.
